sentences.english: We must admit that your unwearied effort is in some measure successful.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认你们不屈不挠的的努力多少是成功的。

sentences.english: He is a soldier who would die game.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个至死不屈的战士。

sentences.english: His sharp, quizzical eyes look back, unblinking and unyielding.
sentences.chinese: 他的敏锐的，疑惑的眼睛看着后面，坚定而不屈。

sentences.english: He is ensanguined battlefield, tough and castiron.
I know that things are tough for you now, but try to keep a stiff upper lip .
sentences.chinese: 我知道现在对你来说事态很严峻，但你要顽强不屈。

sentences.english: Facing the enemies, our soldiers would die rather than surrender.
sentences.chinese: 面对敌人，我们的战士宁死不屈。

sentences.english: The warrior would as soon die as surrender.
For the protection of ZhongLiang blood, shaolin the monk would die rather than surrender, strive to resist.
sentences.chinese: 为保护忠良的血脉，少林众僧宁死不屈，奋力抵抗。

sentences.english: He is endowed with indomitable will.
The wounded soldiers showed much backbone before the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 受伤的士兵在敌人面前表现出了威武不屈的精神。

sentences.english: Self-reliance and self-confidence will demand your toughness.
sentences.chinese: 拥有自主和自信也需要你顽强不屈。

sentences.english: It is hard to bear up under affliction.
sentences.chinese: 受尽折磨仍不屈不挠是很不容易的。

sentences.english: The original fragile flowers ah, but it has an indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 这些原本娇弱的花朵啊，却有着不屈不挠的精神。

sentences.english: A great man is one who has a strong will and an indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 一个大人物是一个具有坚强意志和不屈不挠精神的人。

sentences.english: We were moved by the great courage and solidarity of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 我们为中国人民的坚强不屈和团结一致而感动。

sentences.english: These rays reveal God's uncompromising devotion to life.
sentences.chinese: 这些暖流令我们看见神坚毅不屈地热爱生命。

definition: not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
